ca.mcgill.ecse211.liberty

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.liberty.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class navigates the robot between two points and generate an available path if there is any obstacle along the way. The navigation system drive the robot in a cartesian style. In the beginning and the end of a course, the robot will turn to true 0 first, and roll in x-direction first and then y-direction. If there is an obstacle along the x-axis, it will roll in y first then x. It also controls the top motor during the zipline traversal as well as determining whether the robot is on the zipline or not by the light sensor reading. For the details, see the Software Design Document Section 7.3

                            int speed)

        distance - is the distance required to travel, distance input is in cm
